write a summary about this Dance challenge mobile game: Elevator Pitch
render style + camera angle
Core fantasy
Core mechanic
Setting / Theme
Core Loop
Short-term progression
Medium-term goals
Aspiration
Genre
Game Pillars
Do dance challenges
Share experience by competing and making videos.
Character 
customization
Core Gameplay
● Learn popular dance challenges 
through a gamified and fun 
experience.
● Embody and customize your own 
unique avatar.
● Accept dance battles from other 
players, or replay and watch friends 
& family compete against each 
other.
● Create and challenge friends and 
family with your own unique dance 
moves.
Social Competition & Progression
● Climb the leaderboard and level up 
as you improve and learn more 
dances.
● Showcase your unique customized 
avatar with your dance moves.
● Recruit new and existing players to 
your dance by sharing you dance as 
your avatar.
Business model
● Ingame purchases & Season Pass.
● Motivator/Call 2 action: Avatar customization, Paygate (Time/Pokeball)
● Plenty of opportunities to show off, leveraging the “TikTok” setting: replay weekly 
best score of featured dances. Record your moves and share with friends on social 
media, show replays of competing players side-by-side.
Engagement Drivers
(taken from Game Refinery’s “Player Motivational Drivers”)
?
● Market Fit & Business viability: 
○ Blue ocean: no category-leader in mobile dance-based games
○ Huge & receptive audience: kids 9-14 already engaged in recording & sharing dances with their 
phones; but don’t have a social network aimed at them
○ Well-known business model: season pass + avatar customization are proven monetization 
methods
● Product & Experience:
○ ‘Wow’ factor: instantly flabbergasting state-of-the-art technology 
○ Safe: no privacy concerns due to being avatar-based; no inappropriate content
○ Imagination & Self-expression: become a fantasy dancer, that expresses itself via its imaginative 
looks and unique moves
● Healthy for mind and body: 
○ Fosters building healthy physical habits 
○ Promotes developing a healthy relationship with your own body
○ Encourages comparisons of skill rather than appearance
● Socialization:
○ Creates virtual communities and healthy competition around a fun physical activity
○ Foments memorable real-world interactions with parents, siblings, friends, classmates...
Dance Challenge - Selling Points
Prototype
A step in the process of creating an Vertical slice & MVP. Purpose is to discover possible fun features, and 
explore and answer the related hypotheses & questions to a game mechanic as defined in the game design 
document.
Vertical slice
A vertical slice is a fully-playable portion of a game that shows its developer’s intended player experience. This 
means its key features and systems are all working together properly, complete with assets that represent – 
and this is important – final quality.
MVP
An MVP is a stand-alone play experience that is a complete game with only the essential features. MVPs are 
usually designed to test engagement and efficacy with end users or test the game in the market.
Soft launch
Soft launch of the MVP under a white label for a certain target region. The advantage of the MVP is that you 
may save time and money to get your key questions answered more quickly. However, you have to have 
enough features to really answer those questions so development is usually not as quick as people may think.
Workshop to define estimate contents of milestones on January 4th, 2023.
Roadmap and dates for milestones to be set by January 13th, 2023.
Milestones definitions

Dance Challenge is a mobile game that allows players to learn and perform popular dance challenges in a fun and gamified experience. Players can customize their own unique avatar and compete against others in dance battles, or watch and replay friends and family compete against each other. The game has a social aspect, with a leaderboard and the ability to share videos of dance performances on social media. The game has a season pass and avatar customization as monetization options, and is targeting the 9-14 age group. It aims to foster healthy physical habits and a healthy relationship with one's own body, and create virtual communities around a fun physical activity. A prototype and vertical slice of the game have been created, with a plan to soft launch an MVP under a white label in a target region. The roadmap and milestones for the game's development will be set in the coming weeks.
Write a rejection mail and explain why I don't think a dance challenge mobile game is a good investment, and base it on similar apps or companies with reference to them.

Dear [Investor],

Thank you for considering investing in our dance challenge mobile game. After careful consideration, we have decided not to proceed with your investment offer.

One of the main reasons for this decision is the saturation of the market for dance-based mobile games. There are already several successful games in this category, such as Just Dance and Dance Dance Revolution, which have established themselves as industry leaders. It would be challenging for a new entrant, such as our game, to compete with these established brands and capture a significant market share.

In addition, the business model for our game, which relies on in-game purchases and a season pass, has been tried by many other companies and has had mixed results. We are not confident that this model would be successful for our game, especially given the high level of competition in the market.

Finally, the development of a mobile game is a time-intensive and costly process, and we believe there are more financially viable opportunities for investment at this time.

Thank you again for considering our game. We appreciate your interest and look forward to discussing other potential investment opportunities with you in the future.

Sincerely,
[Your Name]
Write an informal rejection mail to a friend, like the one above, and make it in Norwegian

Hei [venn],

Takk for at du vurderer å investere i vårt dansespill for mobiltelefoner. Etter grundig vurdering har vi bestemt oss for å ikke gå videre med tilbudet ditt om investering.

En av hovedårsakene til dette er oversaturasjonen av markedet for dansespill for mobiltelefoner. Det finnes allerede flere vellykkede spill i denne kategorien, som Just Dance og Dance Dance Revolution, som har etablert seg som bransjeledere. Det vil være utfordrende for et nytt selskap som vårt å konkurrere med disse etablerte merkevarene og fange en betydelig markedsandel.

I tillegg har forretningsmodellen for vårt spill, som bygger på kjøp i spillet og en sesongpass, blitt prøvd av mange andre selskaper og har hatt blandet suksess. Vi er ikke sikre på at denne modellen vil være vellykket for vårt spill, spesielt med tanke på den høye konkurransen i markedet.

Til slutt er utviklingen av et mobilspill en tidkrevende og kostbar prosess, og vi mener det finnes mer lønnsomme investeringsmuligheter for tiden.

Takk igjen for at du vurderer vårt spill. Vi setter pris på interessen din, og ser frem til å diskutere andre potensielle investeringsmuligheter med deg i fremtiden.

Hilsen,
[Ditt navn]

Skriv et svar på dette spørsmålet, og inkluder at jeg begynte med investeringer for å gi tilbake til nye grundere med erfaring fra min egen reise som grunder: – Hvorfor begynte du å investere i startups?

Jeg begynte å investere i startups for å gi tilbake til nye gründere og dele erfaringene jeg har gjort som gründer. Min egen reise som gründer har vært både opp- og nedturer, og jeg har lært mye om hva som skal til for å lykkes som gründer. Jeg ønsker å bidra til at andre gründere kan få muligheten til å lære av mine erfaringer, og samtidig få muligheten til å vokse og utvikle sine egne ideer og selskaper.

Jeg tror også at investering i startups er en god måte å bidra til å støtte opp om innovasjon og nyskaping, og å bidra til å forme fremtiden. Gjennom å investere i spennende og lovende startups, kan vi bidra til å skape nye muligheter og løse utfordringer i samfunnet.

Så, i korte trekk, begynte jeg å investere i startups for å gi tilbake til nye gründere og bidra til å støtte opp om innovasjon og nyskaping.
